column1: == Production ==
=== Development ===
Director
column3: and designer Michel Ocelot has said that two starting points for the production were his desire to create a work set in Paris
column4: and an originally separate desire to create one on the topic of male suppression and abuse of women and girls.

column1: He chose to combine these in a narrative which takes place in the Belle Époque
column3: a decade in which several historical firsts for women in France were made.

column1: The film depicts some of the many notable historical figures who were often present in the city at the time
column2: and features a fictionalized version of the opera singer Emma Calvé as a supporting character. However
column3: it simultaneously intentionally diverges from real history (and
column5: laws of science) in its metaphorical main plot and inclusion of retrofuturist technology influenced by various works of Jules Verne and The Phantom of the Opera by Gaston Leroux.
